intro: Corydalis laelia subsp. bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutanese corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Bhutan and adjacent areas. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes, often found in mountainous forests and meadows. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
